h3RF4JlcSmr0WFehVMdCYA.text: I was here on a Saturday night at around 7PM and was pleasantly surprised to see that this place wasn't super noisy. The food was delicious, I really enjoyed the cocktail soju that they had. It was sweet and went along really well with the bulgogi Nachos that we ordered. The staff was very attentive and helpful and answered any questions that we had about food or anything else.  They also have karaoke which I found to be a nice touch and added to the friendly atmosphere they had going on.  I will definitely be going back soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Drunken Tiger - Mesa, AZ, United States. Bulgogi Nachos are so good!

fHZUtRMA-6HviYqJ9IBX1A.text: We went last Friday and they only have one waiter.  We ordered the grilled chicken which didn't even looked like it was grilled and they didn't even bring any kimchi. B95KxDNwFeQ2trmHyT1hxw.text: Korean bbq at the Drunken tiger is a drunken tiger upper cut to my wallet!  First off this place is a bar, wouldn't say kid friendly by any means, they ask you to request water refills when they can just ask if you would like more water, what a conundrum?  The pot stickers were great, most times they are boiled, these were pan fried and crispy, the fire chicken was to hot and to be honest I didn't enjoy it at all.  The star of the show was the Korean red wings, these were so flavorful sweet with a hint spicy, great taste.  Last was the galbi spare ribs, $20 they were good, I don't think it was worth $20 but it was worth trying once.  This seems like a good place to hang and get food with friends after getting drunk somewhere else.  Probably won't be going back here but the wings were awesome!

HKnfl7ZLHGgAVFFxzrObLw.text: Worst service I've ever had, ever. We walked in and nobody was anywhere near the door to greet us. When the host/server finally walked up to us and asked how many, after we told her she stopped in the middle of us telling her to exchange jokes with another server! We sat down and nobody took our food order for at least 15 minutes (btw there were only 4 parties in the place) I had to get up and ASK OUR SERVER FOR WATER because she NEVER brought us any.   When our food came, in a timely manner, the bao was decent but had very little meat and the ramen was basically the kind you buy for $90 cents with a few veggies thrown in. Soggy in some parts and undercooked in others.  I watched the wait staff taking shots at the bar.   I get that this place is supposed to have a bar atmosphere, but c'mon, at least ask me if I need water dude.

Hu4b1VbtyZr9co2T1oe6_g.text: This place has a casual bar feel and the best part about the atmosphere is the Kpop music playing in the background.  They have karaoke, but no one was singing.  We ordered steamed egg, mozzarella sticks, tofu kimchi (tofu, pork belly, & kimchi), and seafood pancake. The mozzarella sticks were fried perfectly, the tofu kimchi was definitely delicious, and the steamed egg was great. The seafood pancake was a little undercooked, but we brought it home and heated it up in a pan so it tasted really good when cooked more.  Service was fast and curt.  Overall, I would go back for the food.

I1hcfI09uSiY5FPQ_wcKvQ.text: Saw this was fairly new, definitely too me it was new... Had to try this, based on the pics from this place, had been craving some good KFC (Korean Fried Chicken).  We ordered the KFC (Padak style), Bulgogi Nachos, Spicy Pork & Kim Chi/Bacon Fried Rice.  Well, the KFC was ok, a bit dry, but I can look past that since it is white meat...but to add green onions, it's $2.00 more...don't get me wrong...I don't mind paying, but for what we got and the quality, not as much.  The Bulgogi nachos were ok, nice intro of some fusion there.  The spicy pork was really good though, that's why I can say I would go back.  The Kim Chi/Bacon fried rice was ok, would like to have had more kim chi though.  I would definitely recommend, because the overall quality is worth it and the server was fairly attentive, considering he had a full house and he was basically the only server for a bit.  Then another waitress showed up, so it helped.

69yIap3mb8NJFHigfdnzeQ.text: So disappointed with this place. We went with another couple and were expecting something amazing based on all the reviews. We were seated right away and received some water. They didn't give us a menus until 10 minutes later and we had to ask for one. They only gave us two menus for our party of four. We ordered appetizers and drinks and that took another 15 minutes. They didn't have their watermelon drink and that was disappointing. Twenty minutes later we were asked if we wanted to order and we ordered the Udon, Korean Fried chicken and Orange Flavored Chicken. All of us are not experts at using chop sticks so we asked for forks. The waiter came back with spoons because they ran out of forks. There was a large group having dinner, but how could you run out of forks. The food was dry and chewy. The room was dark and looked a bit dirty. There  were wine glasses hanging above  the bar that had a thick dirty built up. We will not return.

Lh4kcXreEBaB91i2quVm5A.text: I'm pleasantly surprised by the food here and how good it tasted. We started off with the watermelon soju which was topped with fruity pebbles and pop rocks. Yummm! It definitely could have used more alcohol (maybe one more extra bottle of soju ) but tasty. I don't think it's worth $22 but perfect to share with your group of friends. We also got the Bulgogi fries, corn cheese and chicken wings. The fries were crunchy and would satisfy those late night cravings. The portion of the fries are huge so you can order one and share it amongst your friends. The corn cheese was tasty and the  chicken wings had a nice kick of spice

DKS09ewy3e9WngLkBTbQiw.text: So, I must admit... I originally went here hoping to scoop myself a hot piece of Korean Man Candy because I was under the impression that it was a bar. It is not a bar. It is a dimly lit restaurant. But the food is delicious, the portions are huge, and they blast kpop, which is the fastest way to my heart.  The real showstopper here is the cheese corn. Which sounds like a venereal disease, but I promise you, it is one of the greatest things I've ever eaten. It's so melty and salty and kind of sweet and greasy and amazing. Their bulgogi is also quite superb and you can tell it's authentic.  The table I was sitting at felt wobbly, the chairs were horrible, and the service was a little slow (there was only one server for the whole restaurant and I could tell he was being overworked) so that's the only reason I'm giving them 4 stars instead of 5.   Overall, this is a solid place and it is 100% worth your money and time. I may have left without the Korean hunk that I was looking for, but I did leave with a full belly and a soju buzz. And that's really all a girl can ask for  \_()_/

YF14K9WPtr6dL1ocDA0V_g.text: I came here with pretty high expectations!  I had heard about this place from several of my Yelper friends and what the hey lets do it!  The place is dark and 90's style karaoke bar.  I sat at the bar; small selections, but I can make do.  My buddy joined me tonight and we were intrigued by the fusion of American bar food and Korean bites.  We started withe Bulgogi Cheese Fries along with some Korean Fried Chicken.  My buddy also ordered their Ramen.  Starting with the fries I was definitely excited to try!  Needless to say, the fries were cooked well and crunchy with the cheese oozing, but I rather find it lacking in the Bulgogi department. (Insert Sad Emoji)  As we proceeded with the Fried Korean Chicken; pretty much popcorn chicken with a side of sweet and spicy sauce and chipotle mayo.  I can see how the chicken would work as beer food.  In the end, Drunken Tiger is a cool spot, but it just didn't do it for me.  I like the concept, but definitely needs more crafting in their part.  I rather enjoyed my quick visit, but we'll see if there's a come back! - Enjoy!

OdwyUgwk9sju1CBBqD01kg.text: Decided to give DT another GO, and I have to say I was incredibly impressed with their service. It was pretty busy but our waitress was on top of it and made sure we had our drinks and food right away. My little sis and I ordered the bugolgi fries again and the Korean fried chicken. So good! Very happy with the overall experience the 2nd time around.

61KUKwHi3m6ujq9bx7m2pw.text: According to legend, 5,000 years ago a Chinese empress discovered silk when a silkworm cocoon fell into her tea. Here at Drunken Tiger, you can find silkworms in your soup!  What a fun filled night with Adam A., Karen W., her husband David, Grace O. (Nice to finally meet ya, missy!), and Glenn! There was a parade of three popcorn chicken dishes (the Padak Chicken coming with green onions and different sauces), KBBQ, a seafood pancake, Bulgogi fries, and a steamy stinky bowl of silkworm pupae soup. Most of the bites were pretty delicious, especially the Bulgogi fries, but that silkworm soup... I can't say I'm a fan. Grace describes it best by comparing the texture to soft shell crab. The taste? It tastes like it smells and it smells pretty bad. For $10, you too can have the same experience! If anything, the silkworms look freaky as heck and will give you the shivers.  We also shared a watermelon soju that Grace and I ended up taking over. To be fair, there didn't seem to be much soju. The Fruity Pebbles were fun when they were crunchy but got soggy at the end. We also liked the Pop Rocks that came with our drink.  I felt like I was in Willy Wonka! "Come with me and you'll be in a world of pure imagination..."  Drunken Tiger is a fun place to go with a group of pals. Stop by for their Happy Hour and enjoy some decent eats!  There's a limited quantity of watermelon soju so plan accordingly!

8QmeyjlCm6yBFHf7teO9Ng.text: Fun fact: Drunken Tiger is the name of a famous Korean hip-hop band that made their debut in 1999. Review 9/10 for the 10 bookmarked businesses to review before the end of 2016! From Meagan B.'s thread: yelp.com/topic/phoenix-y... The menu at Drunken Tiger is fairly similar to its predecessor Cafe Agit with a few more bar food type foods thrown into the mix like nachos and fries. We ordered a ton of food, most of it some sort of fried chicken. The padak chicken had a light crispy batter with the requisite curly strips of green onion on top, served with a wasabi/horseradish soy sauce and a creamier sweet sauce. The popcorn chicken was essentially the same as the padak but with different dipping sauces (A sweet chile sauce and another creamy sauce). The grilled meats we had were the kalbi and spicy pork. The kalbi had a good marinade on it and had a nice proportion of meat on the platter. The spicy pork was tender, well seasoned and I liked how it actually delivered on the spiciness level unlike other Korean restaurants where there is barely a whiff of chile pepper in their "spicy" marinated grilled meat. I did make a special request for bulgolgi fries which were essentially the fries version of their bulgolgi nachos. The fries had a light crispness, smothered in gooey cheese and topped with olives, pico de gallo, jalapenos, and chopped up bulgolgi. It tasted great overall and was a huge portion but I do wish I could taste a little more of the bulgolgi flavor and meat in the meal. We also ordered some seafood pancake which was generously filled with seafood, with a crispy crust to contrast with the softer textures of the filling. Our Bizarre Foods moment came when someone ordered the silkworm soup. It came out piping hot, and had a weird funky aroma to me. I figured hey, I'll try almost anything once so why not try this? I was handed two silkworms on my plate. I examined them and tried to ignore the fact that they looked like something that I pay an exterminator to get rid of every month. The actual broth they were "cocooned" in was bold and fiery. I bit into a corner of a silkworm to find it was too chewy and chitinous for my tastes so I just ended up swallowing them whole like a bitter pill, following each swallow with a copious amount of soju. Even though I wasn't really a fan of the soup I appreciate that they offer this dish to those that do enjoy it! Now the soju... It was served in a gigantic hollowed out watermelon, blended with fresh watermelon pulp and juice, topped with Fruity Pebbles and Pop Rocks. Truly a sight to behold and a combination that makes you wonder if someone had been on a mind-bending substance while thinking of this drink (Or maybe they had eaten too many silkworms that day). I liked the fresh watermelon but I don't think there was a lot of soju in the actual drink since I was feeling barely anything after a few rounds. There was a mix up as we were initially served a regular bulgolgi plate instead of the fries, and I did have to remind the server about a missing drink order, but the server was apologetic and provided friendly service. The interior seems pretty much the same was Cafe Agit, with various TV screens either playing a game or K-Pop. Overall I think this a great option for late night eats or if you want Korean food for dinner. There were a good number of people seated here on a Friday night having conversations in Korean which is always a good sign that the food and beverage here is legit. We had a good time and I'll be back again for more food!

There were mild things for the fragile palates as well. We liked the wings and the rice dishes were good. But the star was the Holy Sh- hot red chicken. Bulgulgi for the babies... Will be back.

GxgWN1W9vzm430pqyNZQSQ.text: Overpriced in my opinion. I got the bulgogi fries, not too crazy about the taste of the meat. The service was very slow. Came with a party of 5 and they forgot an order. Gratuity was put on each bill which they definitely didn't deserve that much due to the service.

cyTp-seOMRzoD4WofMqDHQ.text: I honestly don't understand why my friend love this place so much. I can only assume it for the bar atmosphere along side serving Korean Food with alcohol. I don't agree with other reviewers that the food is over priced because it is meant for sharing... If that was the case the portion would be more for their price. I been here a couple of times and out of all those times I was invited by a friend. The food is above average but for the price they are charging, no thank you. I think their Korean fried chicken here is better than most in Arizona I been to so far and there other food taste about the same as Hidori I would say.

Ag_6ww7PVSlpvM3L6JojtA.text: This a great bar to hang out for happy hour! The food and drinks are authentic, I felt like I was back visiting Korea. My favorite drink is the giant soju drink served in half a watermelon!!! The drink is perfect for sharing amongst friends on a hot summer day.  This drink is not only photogenic it is delicious, refreshing and hella fun. The food that we tried was very good, the wings won as favorite dish at our table. The Korean red sweet and spicy perfectly fried wings are lust worthy. The spicy squid was also sauced and prepared just right, all it needs is a side of white rice. The service was a little slow towards the end of our meal but the food and atmosphere is where this restaurant really shines.

UujJplaxwUpRPf6jiuvrzQ.text: Thumbs up for this place.  This was my second time here and not disappointed on anything that we ordered so far.  I don't remember the name of the dishes but who cares, as long as they are yummy.  Watermelon soju was fun but not as strong as I expected, more soju in it please.

2YALBXb78B01JjCZAJBFTg.text: This is one of my absolute favorite restaurants in the Mesa area. The food is top quality, the ambiance/vibes are casual and enjoyable, and the service is prompt and efficient. My friends and i have tried things like fish cake, udon, ramen, pineapple fried rice, kimchi fries, and the silkworm soup (it is actually good and to me tastes like hominy) The portions are very big, last time i had the fishcake soup and took leftovers home for two meals! All of the servers we have had there are very polite and efficient. Definitely a place to check out!!! 11/10 will keep going

UboJvNwnVpBSeaPO4Rhdrg.text: Definitely a go to spot when you're looking for late night food in Mesa. Atmosphere is great and wide variety of foods and soju. Definitely reccomend the cheesy corn with spicy pork added and the boneless KFC is amazing. I would list more items but it would take up my whole review. The servers are really nice and are attentive to their tables. A plus is that they're open late so it's a great spot for those that work late nights.

d5ojqH0hQY2JF4M4zFiH3g.text: Get the Bulgogi Nacho Fries!!! They are incredibly tasty! The basket is huge, so you can easily share with someone    They also have Karaoke! Win!

0VKpJINb7MHkaVUw7sCXRg.text: We came to the new neighborhood joint tonight for some late night snacks.  We dined on Bulgogi Nacho Fries, Daku Chicken, and the Watermelon Soju.    Very large portions.  Tasty food.  Would come again.  Get ready for the Koreans to rock your mouth with these tasty treats!

OA0ARKOHA2RLpV1KRGxiuA.text: It's mainly just bar food and I haven't tried much, but it has a relaxing atmosphere and I love the steamed egg.

3jHXrP9T-U7dz023gmtuEA.text: Drunken Tiger is a great bar. It reminds me of K town and the bars there. The liquor and beer is well priced and the food is great after you've been drinking (or before). It's definitely more bar food than not so you may have trouble eating dinner here in a traditional sense. Korean bars are about communal eating and drinking, so expect to share plates and bottles. Feel free to ask the servers anything. Their English is plenty good and they would rather you ask than get something you don't want to eat or don't know how to eat.

5qp_cKF3y5XILDOjfWaGXw.text: I literally downloaded Yelp just to leave this review. I heard of this place through friends who all said that it was relatively good. I came in and was seated pretty quickly because there wasn't a wait. After being seated, our server left us to help other tables who came in AFTER us for 10 minutes without giving us menus so we just sat there and waited (the tables who came in after us got served and left way before us). When he finally gave us our menus, he made us wait another 20 minutes before letting us order (at this point we were ready to leave but decided to stick it out cause you never know if the food is going to be amazingly good). After ordering, our food took ages to arrive and when it did, it came in waves and was mediocre at best. Additionally, we couldn't even start eating until 5 minutes after because our server, yet again, took his time to give us plates, prioritizing other tables over a simple task that should have been completed long before.  tl;dr horrible service and mediocre food, save your time and go somewhere else. Gogi and Koreatown are so much better and will actually serve you.

Db70p_ZEFaf_zid8bIaAAg.text: This has got to be the worst customer service I've ever seen. Waiter ignored us the whole time and didn't bring a drink until the very end. The food was overpriced and bland.

4kLCPPWwsYDrA0tDKIJo0w.text: This is more of a 3.5 but not quite a 4 yet...  Drunken tiger is essentially a korean bar/pub. There is flavored soju and Korean fried chicken and a bunch of other bar foods. I came in with a friend after searching for a place that does Korean fried chicken in Phoenix.   The fried chicken was good, but it was drenched in sauce. The soju was good, but it really just a mix so there isn't much to mess up.   Overall, it was good, but service was slow and I miss the table buttons you push for service. While drunken tiger seems A-OK, i'm still on the hunt for a good Korean bar.

tfbg9TRvK0sUgagcYUHEug.text: Went for dinner and karaoke with a friend. Atmosphere.....if you can really call it that was "place going out of business chic. Menu was incredibly odd. Frenc fries, bulgogi meat Velveeta and jalapenos. Preston "fusion" lol. Tried the watermelon soju. Had lovely stomach acebth next day. Karoke was also a joke. Gave it a shot. Will not return.

GROXQzXTP2zGpF4LqQyVsw.text: Finally a great Korean bar in Arizona! The ambience feels like I'm in k-town in LA.   The food is great and the drink specials are excellent. I love coming here with friends. We always order the Korean fried chicken and steamed egg to go with soju/beer. The owner is super friendly too!  Would highly recommend!

309mYnh5TFTTqrSaUirK6w.text: We came here after seeing the food featured on AZ republic. The seafood pancake was definitely the best you can get in the Phoenix area. I'd come here again just for that.   At some point, the owner came by to make sure everything was OK and threw in some extra appetizers! Service was amazing, drinks were great, food was great. Come here. Bring your friends.

GSm7DIc7H9Vq-XyFSKBFdQ.text: Every visit to this establishment is enjoyable. They have great staff that don't rudely correct me when I butcher the names of the menu items. Lol Every time my friends and I leave this place we are always excited for our next dinner and drinks. My favorite things to order are Korean fried chicken, seafood pancake (huge), and bulgogi. My favorite drinks are a pitcher of pineapple soju and the subak soju(crowd pleaser). I still have yet to try the silk worm soup, I'll try it soon!

wzaQysm3dmRbg5YrtzwNDg.text: Great Korean fusion. Decent prices. Great for night time snackers. K-pop on the radio and TVs made for a good environment. Friendly staff and right near the lakeside.

3-uox1x8pE-A-QiHqNwnXA.text: My boyfriend and I were cruising the town in search of a new restaurant when Yelp led us to this place. We love Asian food and sports bars, so Drunken Tiger did not disappoint. We consumed lots of rice wine and yogurt soju, and ate several plates of satisfying Korean drinking food, including cheese corn (where have you been all my life?) and tteokbokki (the grown-up comfort food of my dreams), all while listening to K-pop, and therefore had an all-around great time. We'll probably be back within the week. Two thumbs up-slash-five stars for our new favorite bar!

xi51l8dMCP1AoA-Lb0E9dQ.text: What kind of Korean restaurant doesn't serve kimchi side dishes? The reason Korean restaurants charge more is because the cost of kimchis.  Therefore, this place is the most expensive Korean restaurant in PHX area! The waitress explained that they serve "Korean Street Food", really? Street food with fine dinning price? Let's talk about the food now. If I don't know this a Korean place, I would say it is a Chinese restaurant because I don't taste garlic at all which is the signature taste for Korean food. Oh, by the way, the portion is so small that we had to go to Burger King to get some chicken nuggets. Nevertheless, got robbed once, never again!

CdvFn47nZr0n_4nd_dxqmw.text: They have the best chicken feet I've ever had. I love this place!

Nbjg9FdfEEwLg1M97aqiQA.text: This is a very relaxed restaurant with late night food options. We ordered the seasoned Korean fried chicken, cheese corn, and bulgogi fries. The Korean fried chicken was crispy and seasoned perfectly and the cheese corn is soooo good. The bulgogi fries were way too salty and after a few bites, we left the majority of it untouched but I'll definitely be visiting again soon to try the rest of their menu.

3TtmWCVPWebdagbRAMs80g.text: I love this place! They have amazing food. Some of my favorites would have to be the Bulgogi, corn cheese, pot stickers, and sausage & veggie stir fry. Their Bulgogi is very flavorful and well cooked. It's thinly sliced  marinated beef, that is slightly sweet, and has a soy based saltiness. Along with green onions, and normal onions. The corn cheese is their take on elotes. It's served on a hot plate, with mozzarella, pepper, and green onions. They also have a fire version that's spicy and has pork belly added to it! The pot stickers comes with 7 on a bed of cabbage, drizzled with spicy mayo. They are deep fried. And delicious! The veggie stir fry with sausage is kinda spicy. The veggies consist of cabbage, carrot, onions. The sausage are slices are nicely sized. Thick, but still comfortable enough to eat in one bite. It comes with rice, so you have something to eat it with.  Over all I have always been satisfied, taste wise and full wise! The servers are friendly and will help explain any dishes you might not be sure about. The food gets out fast too. This is deff place where you get multiple plates and share with the people at your table. But don't let that discourage you if it's just you and another person. My boyfriend and I come here, just us, all the time. I would recommend this place to anyone, and I do! :)

SuahgocxQOTPT8eYjbn-Wg.text: Crunchy gizzard and the silkworm soup are my go to for snacks.    The watermelon with pop rocks, fruity pebbles, and soju was also fantastic and mouth watering!

3HzZdvsMk8tkrmzVzEXnUw.text: This is an amazing korean place! their soju is quite amazing. Beef bulgogi is very tasty! Not that packed and great fast service for a weeknight.

BmviHkf0OyD0isxjf-7v8g.text: Came here for some drinks on Friday night. Place was pretty busy. The waiter was super nice and attentive and friendly.  Nice big parking lot outside  Ambience is more of a dim and cozy environment. Lots of drinking.  Love their Soju cocktails Korean music playing in the background. Drinks I believe weren't too expensive.   Good place to hang out and drink before heading out elsewhere  pretty random location on its own in this block.

_fhJq6251GAQ5ct-6Uej1A.text: Came here for dinner with my boyfriend on a Wednesday night. It wasn't crowded so we lucked out since we heard it gets busy. We got seated right away by a sweet waitress. She was friendly and able to answer our questions. We had water to start, which they provide a bottle for to refill your cup until you run out and they will replace. We had a total of 4 dishes to share among 2 and we were able to finish!   - Galbi: this dish came with rice and a side of kimchee. I liked the flavoring but they were a bit overcooked because of the charred pieces all over the meat that overpowered the meat portion on the ribs. Kimchee wasn't spicy, but that was fine. The rice allowed us to eat the rest of our dinner with so it was a good choice with the meat dish. - Silk worm pupae soup: I would never order this without knowing its exceptional, but my boyfriend wanted to try a new dish so we opted in for this versus the usual kimchee stew flavored soups. I will say it isn't bad but also not good enough for us to reorder. My boyfriend said the silkworms were soft since they sit in the soup for awhile, which grossed me out so I only drank the soup and the corn bits. - Corn cheese with pork belly: this dish was double its price when we added the pork belly, but also something we never tried so we opted for it. It was a large size for the cheese corn and pork belly pieces on top. I liked the addition of the green onions too. I love cheese corn for those that know me, so I loved this dish. It also had additional flavoring from the pork belly, greens onions, and strong flavor of white pepper too. I would reorder but can go without pork belly next time for a cheaper price.  - Chicken wings (Korean red): everyone that has been here rave about the wings so we had to try. We should have tried the garlic option, but we went for the Korean red since it had a hint of spice. It wasn't really spicy, but the crispiness of the chicken remained even though there was sauce all over which is awesome. The chicken was also juicy vs dry. Would return just to order the chicken wings and try their other flavors.   Half the dishes came out good, and half didn't. We will have to return to give it another try since this place received such praise among our friends. Left paying around $65 for two people including tips and tax.

8vFX1Afd_NbwZvXi1NAxDQ.text: Drunken Tiger is seriously the best korean pub in Arizona. Their food perfectly represents korean street food. My personal favorite is the corn cheese and tteokkbokki with ramen! Their drinks are super good! Their watermelon soju is super refreshing and perfect for the Arizona heat! It may seem like their food is a little pricey but to me I think it is reasonable. If you are not willing to spend at least $20 here then that's a personal problem. Don't complain about prices being too high when it's just you who can't afford it. Dt's customer service is always amazing and make sure that you are comfortable and happy. Their servers are always checking on bathrooms and tables to make sure they are clean. Honestly I would recommend this pub to everyone and their mothers. If you're reading this make sure to stop by Drunken Tiger because I promise you, you won't regret it.

uHUHbX8Se5W6qhqbBfQgVw.text: I usually drive out to Chandler, Tempe or Phoenix to go out to eat but my husband and I decided to try somewhere a little more close to home. Mesa doesn't have a lot of cool, hip places to eat so our expectations were low. We were pleasantly surprised.  This Korean restaurant has a young, trendy vibe with it's black-walled interior and K-POP videos.  This place is perfect for date night or drinks with friends.    I have to say though that the food is a little pricey and took a while to come out. I do love that they try not to be wasteful.  They don't fill up your water unless you ask and they don't serve you kimchi unless you want it. Kimchi is kind of like the Japanese equivalent of wasabi or ginger, something that is served on the side of most dishes but never gets eaten. I asked for the kimchi because I've never had it and wanted to try it. I took one bite and I was NOT a fan.  I kind of felt terrible for wasting it...  Overall, my husband and I had a good time and enjoyed our food.    CAUTION: Your clothes will reek of Korean BBQ when you get home. Whether that's good or bad, that's up to you.

ApWJRI1StnSFFS645pop7A.text: I went to this place last night. I was just little complain to server. But server is not really good person. Maybe she make a story that I complained big time and she made a story.  The owner was complaining to my friend.  The result is l supposed to apologize to them personally. What do I do wrong? I think they are really don't care. But think about that businesses reputation is very important.  I have a just 1 mouth, 1 mouth can make million mouth in this world.

uoMweLGiSMcrbvTVdbpDkA.text: I've been to Drunken Tiger twice and something keeps me coming back for more.  This is one of the only spots in Phoenix that has ACTUAL  yogurt soju, which is a (++++) in my book! Service is pretty good and their food hits the spot. So far I have had their kimchi fried rice topped off with fried egg and potstickers. My first time I had bulgogi fries (enough for 5 people, seriously). Overall, cool spot to hang out with some friends, oh, and karaoke if you're into that.

0CJaeWWGnzKDcwk3WMWUNw.text: While I don't have a good base for what excellent Korean food is, a buddy and I frequent Drunken Tiger often. The atmosphere is fun, entertaining and hilarious on open Karaoke nights. One unhealthy favorite is the KFC - Korean Friend Chicken - with our without the spicy sauce they toss it in. We also get the okonomiyaki (oktopus balls) which I used to eat while I lived in Japan, and occasionally the bulgolgi. The carved out watermelon adult beverage drink is fun if you want something sweet with a pop rock twist.

yZdD_kvwSv6ga02bFuVjOQ.text: How did it take me so long to find Drunken Tiger? The name alone is great enough!   Drunken Tiger is a Korean bar that has great bar like Korean food and plays hip Kpop music.   We ordered:  1. Fire Chicken -- super spicy chicken with cheese on top. Very good, but prepared to ask for another jug of water to go with it.   2. Bulgogi Fries -- heaping portion of it, it was great but the bulgogi portion was so small and chopped it. I wish they were in bigger pieces. Don't think I'd order again.   3. Tteok Kochi? -- slightly pan-fried rice cakes with this red sauce that had peanuts in it. LOVE this dish. These rice cakes are different than the regular tteokbokki dish since this one isn't really spicy at at all.   Service was excellent, everyone came by and ask how our food was, and was super friendly.   I would give this place 4.5 stars, and I'll just round up to 5 on Yelp since their service was great, and I definitely will come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Drunken Tiger - Mesa, AZ, United States. Spicy Fire Chicken!!! So spicy
Photo of Drunken Tiger - Mesa, AZ, United States. Bulgogi Fries! Huge portion, not enough bulgogi
Photo of Drunken Tiger - Mesa, AZ, United States. Tteok kochi! Super good!

eQJ-78g8YgAUwoPfsmOXcw.text: We tried this place for the first time tonight for dinner. We had heard great comments & saw how busy it was day after day for quite some time. We thought, let's give it a try! We were a party of 4 & arrived an hour after opening. We had walked in & the place was already fairly packed. We weren't approached to be seated right away ,instead were told we could sit in the middle area. Five minutes after sitting our waiter came over with 2 menus & we were told they didn't have enough menus for everyone. We all ordered cocktails & literally 10 minutes later they brought over the drinks. After we all took a sip it was another 10 minutes till our waiter came back to take half our order. Our appetizers slowly trickled out, one by one. We were brought 3 plates instead of 4 & were told all of the forks were dirty so none were available. The potstickers & mozzarella sticks had good flavor, but I didn't understand the ketchup dip for the mozzarella sticks. Weird combo.  We never were checked on while our food was cooking. Once the food came out it wasn't at all what we were expecting. Everything was fried & very little sauce if none on all the food.   All 4 of us were so very unhappy with our experience. We said to each other, we should have just walked over to Macayo's instead. Our final review is, terrible service, horrible food that leaves you feeling unhealthy & greasy, all ending with a $50 tab.  Needless to say, none of us will be returning. But now we have our own opinion everytime we pass by.

rs6ystsl1i-IM3GQCTZ11g.text: Hands down the best meal we have had in a long time!  We shared the cream corn, bulgogi, and salt and pepper shrimp.  Needless to say we stuffed ourselves to the fullest.  I kept looking across the table and saying, "how are you still eating!"  We also tried a green apple Good Day which was so smooth and sweet; you could easily get lit AF drinking that!  I think we may actually go back tonight just to try more of the menu!

photos.caption: Photo of Drunken Tiger - Mesa, AZ, United States. Its just as good at home!  Bulgogi...
Photo of Drunken Tiger - Mesa, AZ, United States. Its just as good at home! KFC in red sauce...
Photo of Drunken Tiger - Mesa, AZ, United States. The most amazing bulgogi ever - $16.99

BFh_piwFgjPKDEchdnS0jQ.text: Horrible place, horrible owners. They wanted us to spend at least $10 per person before you can karaoke because it's "too expensive" for them otherwise. We were $8 shy of $10 per person and they wouldn't let us karaoke. We went there to drink and karaoke, I called ahead of time and they told me they have karaoke the whole time so we went. Biggest mistake. If you're looking to have fun and drink with friends, don't go there. Their greed ruined our night. I don't know who goes to a bar and immediately spends $50 upon arrival. I get it, we weren't eating but we were definitely planning on being there awhile. They eventually told us we can karaoke for $5 a song, which to me is ridiculous since they say they offer it, but no where does it say you have to be up to a $10 bill per person before you can sing. I think they are just money hungry and would rather rip people off then try to be an honest business. I have never been treated so badly I don't know how this place is even open still since the other reviews say the food is pretty bad.  In the reply from the owner he says I stayed and drank one tower for 2 hours. But we were waiting for friends to show up before ordering. Idk how you expect us to finish any sooner? We would have ordered more if they were nicer to us. I didn't want anything free we just wanted a place to hang out and drink. It's funny they can't decide if they're a restaurant or a bar. If you're named "Drunken tiger " why would you say you're more of a restaurant when even the menu is drink based like "drunk munchies" it makes no sense with the theme of the bar or restaurant whatever you want to call yourselves today. I didn't curse I just wanted to leave. I also didn't even really talk to either of you, your waiter was super friendly and understood where we were coming from. Too bad because we were enjoying ourselves for awhile at first. You can say it's on camera but I don't really care. I just hope others come and can enjoy without being treated like we were.

ILX8Pcpr7UEUY27Ipreqfw.text: This place is good. They ha s bulgolgi fries which I've never seen at any other Korean restaurant. The appetizer was a size good enough for like 2-3 people. There was little bulgolgi and quite expensive ($19.99). I got the boneless Korean fried chicken (KFC) because my friend said it is usually really good at other places. It was nothing special. Just regular popcorn chicken only with a dipping sauce not so flavorful.   There is dish that has rice cake and you can add egg, ramen noodles and cheese to it. That was pretty good however the sauce is really thick and sweet. I just mainly liked it because of the rice cakes.   My most favorite thing here is the takoyaki. It is always so weird how whenever I go to a restaurant, one of the things that become my favorite there are always the food outside of the ethnic group. The takoyaki was delicious but the fish flakes did not move around much. It barely moved actually, I do not know why...   I find it weird how they call dumplings "potstickers" at this place... There is an automatic 18% service charge fee at the end. Did not get to take a picture of the rice cake!

photos.caption: Photo of Drunken Tiger - Mesa, AZ, United States
Photo of Drunken Tiger - Mesa, AZ, United States

C5wnuaI9mc_lv6G4E0iOaw.text: Update:  Message from manager was polite and informative. I added one more star.   I always get sick whenever I eat here. However, I always come back every few months thinking that they may have improved. So I was craving Korean fried chicken and thought I would give this place another try. However, I was extremely disappointed. It was nothing like the traditional yang yum chicken I was used too. What happened? They used to make this somewhat decently. The flavors here seem inconsistent. This time the yang yum chicken didn't taste anything like what I was expecting. For one, I was expecting crispy fried chicken with bones still in and a slightly sweet, yet spicy sauce. However, what I got was a soggy mess of popcorn chicken with a salty, spicy sauce. I also got the fried rice. It was super heavy and hard to digest. It didn't taste like kimchi fried rice at all. There was barely any kimchi, and I got mostly the hard end bits that I would never serve a guest. I guess that is what I get for ordering at a bar.

4C1Su-uRDnGNy7BKvE_rmg.text: Me and my boyfriend went on a Friday night and there was only 2 people serving. So I understand that it is hard :/ however, they served the table that came in after us first and we were waiting for 40 minutes. Minus 1 star.   The food was alright. We got the bulgogi ($17ish) and bulgogi fries ($12). The food wasn't warm enough and got cold pretty fast :/ the bulgogi fries had good cheesy fries but the fries tasted a little stale. Minus 1 star.  Overall, I like the atmosphere of this place. The concept of the Karaoke is really cool and I like that it's dark in there. It is good beer food, but not that great if you're sober.

1mQmKr-i19kNmYfHeSgntg.text: Great place, friendly service, love the atmosphere and the music, it was also super clean. The food was amazing, Mos def will be back SOON! My family enjoyed it, our new Fav Korean spot!

aF1vXyoupXxZyhClPOHibA.text: Not a bad place. I heard a lot of my friends come here for the Bulgogi fries so I wanted to try. It's big enough to probably feed 2-3 people which is a plus. Although it's pretty expensive. The fries were $16.99. They have Tteokokki which is a Korean noodle dish that you can add different stuff like cheese, egg, noodles, and etc. The price for that was ($10.99) Koreans generally have there signature spicy red sauce so it was on a lot of my friends meals such as my friends Korean Fried Chicken and Kimchi Friend Rice. For myself I got Takoyaki which are ball shaped snack that has tempura and octopus. It was okay the price for that was $6.99. It's a cute restaurant with a good environment like karaoke. I would only go for the Bulgogi Fries honestly.

OAgRzh6hgJHuDKIKx0wmIQ.text: Great food great vibe.  Karaoke for those feeling inspired to sing. Variety of bottled beverages to choose from.  Great for a late night snack.  Kitchen open until 1:20 am. The bulgogi is fantastic,  the chicken wings just the right crisp then sauced with the result being excellent wings. The rice dishes are all delicious  and perfectly cooked. The service matched the food and was excellent as well.   The food is so great and the staff is so attentive to the details it makes for a great place to lose track of time and have a good time.  The music keeps the place lively great place to check out.  Highly recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Drunken Tiger - Mesa, AZ, United States

8l_V7L8ufztYrVa1vDzjXw.text: I've visited this place before, about two years ago and thoroughly enjoyed myself both times. The cuisine is Korean street food and this is one of the few places where they have Korean rice wine. It's called makkoli. I highly recommend mixing it with some sprite. It's amazing. My friends and I ordered their watermelon punch drink and it was definitely worth it to at least try. The presentation is overwhelming, yet fun. They have ladles to scoop the drink up with the fruity pebbles and small cups. It wasn't strong but the flavor was good. We got the beef bulgogi, bao, cheesy corn and seafood pancake. It was just the right amount of food to share between three people. The bao is AMAZING here. The staff was friendly and accommodating.  I also like that they're authentic and play Korean music.  I highly recommend checking them out. They're located at a small shopping center in Mesa but it's worth the drive to at least try.

UWvb0dKmnpx_uOX6VVgmmg.text: Good food, nice ambience. Service can be a little slow but not bad. Great place for 21st birthdays

wadTDM9Dlma7l-Rjs5JMvQ.text: Great food and atmosphere!  Very good for spot to grab drinks with friends and enjoy some authentic Korean food.

c3RUlgVDstDQCCe_w1Mmbw.text: I've already been here twice within this past week and I can say that I'm already a big fan of the place. The servers here are not only quick with service, but they are also very friendly and personable with their customers. The first night I went here I had the Bulgogi Nacho Fries. It's basically like carne asada fries, but with a Korean twist on it since they are adding bulgogi meat instead of carne asada. Only thing they can do to improve it would be to add a bit more bulgogi. The second night I had the Korean Fried Chicken (KFC) and it was so delicious!! I recommend pairing it with soju or beer. All in all, I'll definitely be coming back and I'll be bringing more friends with me!!~

NsaFe1RJbJDzlj2KtVk0oQ.text: It was our first time here. The service was great. Any questions we had about the menu or drinks our server was more than happy to answer. Would recommend this restaurant

Kxdp3bJg8oaAwXyLEKJoIw.text: The food and atmosphere was great. And the food was delicious it is a little pricy but service was excellent!!

WCeC-YbdUK27VTwKUUD_-w.text: As a huge fan of the LA Korea Town bar scene Drunken Tiger is a much needed spot here in Phoenix. Traditional Korean bar food mixed with modern day fusion choices, and full stock of Korean drink choice, DT has become my go to spot for my Ktown fix. Although nothing can replace ktown this is definitely a close second.

D8b4W_2vayf4JrBxMuLY-Q.text: Since coming to AZ we have been looking for a place with good Korean food.  Being part Korean and always being around authentic food makes that an even more difficult task for me.  I stumbled across this place and will definitely be coming back regularly! I had the pork belly salad and my hubby had the fried chicken (yangnyeom)--delicious! Of course we paired it with Hite and makkeoli :)  The staff is friendly and the atmosphere is relaxed and a great place to just chill, eat good Korean food and have a few drinks.  Looking forward to the watermelon soju bowl next time!

X2x__f8ymRC4L16B6JUzSg.text: Me and my family came here for my 21st birthday in May. I saw the restaurant by chance on my way to a hair appointment several months earlier and was pretty excited. I love Korean culture, so I was excited to get to try some of the food, and I figured the watermelon soju would be a fun first bar experience. We tried a few different menu items, and although everyone was a little nervous to try flavors out of their comfort zones, they all loved it. I definitely had the best 21st birthday I could ever imagine! My recommendations would definitely be getting the bulgogi nachos, they're super good! And if you like fruity drinks and you're with a group that also like fruity drinks, the watermelon soju is worth trying for sure! My parents still talk about how much they enjoyed the seafood pancake. The chicken was delicious as well! Seriously, check this place out! It's a hidden gem! I definitely plan on coming back soon, and hopefully next time I'll get a chance to do a little karaoke and flaunt my Kpop skills.

ugHHSBRaKft-q_UrVtbHQg.text: Real cool eatery. Very low key and good place to get Korean bar food (whatever that may be.) Fair warning they do not serve traditional Kimchee so if you're looking for that you will be disappointed. Nice, attentive and patient staff.

fjdYKJ--swUZKdug7nwkBw.text: It's hard to write this review. I really want to endorse and talk it up. The food is decent-good. It has great ideas for their menu. The flavor sometimes lack. I LOVE their steamed egg. I can't get enough of it. Their service is often slow. Please know it's not because they are lazy or just don't care. It's because they are under staffed. I feel if there were more structure and a few more people. It would run so smoothly. The decor.... well everything is black. Feels dingy, college-y. Granted it's surrounded by college students. But you shouldn't be like this. In my opinion. Create an atmosphere that isn't shrouded in black. I really do enjoy this place but it's mainly because I am distracted by the company that I go with here. They've gotten to know the staff and they make it interesting and fun. The inconsistencies I'm sure will iron out in time and I can only assume so will the color scheme and atmosphere . I look forward to seeing this.

maluGcufN7_OlEuakDCIxw.text: After reading and hearing multiple good reviews about Drunken Tiger I had to check it out. This place definitely lived up to its name. I shared the watermelon Soju drink with my friends and it was very refreshing and tasty. Not an over powering watermelon taste at all. A must try if you come while it's in season. Tried a variety of foods including pot stickers, sweet and sour chicken and sausage and veggie stir fry. My favorite of the three was the stir fry. It had a sweet and spicy taste that was blended perfectly together. The energetic Korean music played throughout the restaurant kept with the Korean theme. Can't wait to come back and check out the karaoke.

kCeRVhUxe5BuKYSICoavYw.text: There are four requirements to having a great dining experience: tasty food, cold drinks, relaxing atmosphere and welcoming service. Drunken Tiger excels in all four categories. Although the restaurant is fully seated, food still arrives promptly to the table while water and drinks are refilled frequently. They have a great variety of korean cuisine; such as traditional spicy rice cakes or something with a twist like their bulgogi fries. Drinks are fairly priced. There really isn't a better combination than korean fried chicken with a cold sip of soju to wash greasy goodness all down! A great first time experience that will keep my business coming!

Photo of Drunken Tiger - Mesa, AZ, United States. Potato Pancake special $5.99...

3-oJ5eD7PHeUu4SNxNh74g.text: Drunken Tiger is legitimately my favorite place. This is where I take all my out-of-town friends, where my friends and I catch up over drinks, I had my birthday dinner here...Once, I came here five times in a week with different people...and they're only open six days a week. Not sure if that's impressive or embarrassing haha.   But I've had a bunch of items on the menu. People say it's overpriced, but it's because the portions are meant for sharing. The Korean Fried Chicken or Soy Garlic Chicken is always a solid choice. I LOVE french fries so the Kimchi Pork Fries or Animal-style Fries (secret menu item) are both amazing.   If you're looking for something on the spicier side and not fried, my go-to items are the Tofu Kimchi (sounds bland, but is so tasty, especially with the pork belly mixed in) or the Spicy Mussels.   If you're looking for something a little more green, I recently tried the Pork Belly Salad and it was great! It had chopped up perilla leaves in it (which I love!) and it gave the salad a minty, bold taste.   I'm also a fan of the flavored sojus. Plum, white grape, and peach are my favorite!   I could write a novel about how much I love this place and everything else I've ordered, but I highly suggest trying yourself!

photos.caption: Photo of Drunken Tiger - Mesa, AZ, United States. Steamed egg and plum soju
Photo of Drunken Tiger - Mesa, AZ, United States. Favorite spot for drinks + munchies with friends
Photo of Drunken Tiger - Mesa, AZ, United States. Secret menu item: Animal Style Fries (for True Drunken Tiger fans!)

xcWm04Trwl8iaf268EREXg.text: Came for a birthday with a group. They wanted us to minimum spend $20 adults and $10 for children. Minimum policy? Ridiculous. I don't mind spending money, but I don't want to be forced to eat a certain amount. They were dead, but with bad customer service that makes sense.

8NgePGyq4VhyOHaPGCn2fw.text: Finally checked this place out after months of trolling the reviews. I think I just found my perfect Korean dive bar. Best part: I can walk home if I've had one soju bottle too many!   Korean bar food with some American comfort food fusion like the bulgogi fries, which were pretty awesome. Spicy fire chicken was addicting, and the corn aka "Korean elote" was impressive. Spam and eggs, fried chicken are other items on the menu that are on my "to try" list.   We ordered makkoli (milky rice wine) and Soju (rice wine-much stronger than makkoli) and shared between 4 people, as well as a pitcher of Cass. Karaoke singers are comically terrible here, but I feel like that is part of the charm.   My only concern was that there were only two servers in the entire bar/restaurant so I had to hunt my server down every now and then. Service was friendly, so it wasn't a deal breaker. Also, there are only single person bathrooms, so it could be a bit of a line to use the bathroom when it's crowded.   Overall, I enjoyed myself and my friends who came along enjoyed a taste of Korean bar food. I can't wait to go back and hopefully the watermelon soju with fruity pebbles and pop rocks is in season!

Huy2llqM6rfgrC_XGRjUzA.text: The Very Berry Soju is delicious and the pitcher is perfect for a big party! We also had a few orders of the Fire Wings which were sauced to perfection. Definitely finger licking good, and the cabbage compliments it perfectly. Great late night grub spot!

yYhUWlN0HJMu0srvs0ksYw.text: This place is soo good I order there every Friday night. Not only will you have a fun time with your friends, but you'll leave with a full and satisfied belly.  My usual order is their tteok kochi, soy garlic chicken, and either galbi or bulgogi. The tteok kocki is like a chewy rice ball in their spicy sauce. The soy garlic chicken is my favorite and is pure deliciousness. A fried chicken soaked in garlic sauce. Really everything on their menu is full of flavor. It can be a bit oily but that's what makes is sooo tasteful.  I highly recommended this place for a night out. ENJOY!!

rhcJ5h5EuQ8ZTtqP9mTDkw.text: Damn I didn't see a lot of Korean spots around so I was skeptical about this spot. But it felt like the spots back in Ktown California when I walked inside. Low lighting inside. Lots of soju. Kpop videos on the screen. The food came out like mountains. They got great dishes here. The fried chicken is delicious with 4 sauces. The corn cheese with spicy pork was like kids eating candy. The Kalbi short rib was eaten so fast. I was very satisfied with the food washing it down with peach soju. After a few bottles we started singing karaoke on the tv screens. Good fun times with great food  Recommendation: corn cheese, kalbi short rib, fried chicken , and peach soju

ChPMWl73m1BDg6mejFC4Ww.text: Drunken Tiger took us last night!  First and foremost to clear things up: Drunken Tiger is a bar. It is a restaurant second. There were no other children but mine and it made things awkward. The walls are black, music loud and neon signs provided more light then the lightbulbs... it was 5pm. Very fun if your with friends , not toddlers. :/  First order of business, appetizers. We decided on the Fire Chicken, fried potstickers and chicken wings.  Fire Chicken: WAY TOO HOT. Made me sick all night HOT. Heartburn all night HOT. We could not eat it and beware when ordering. Potstickers: so much better fried than steamed, we had to actually order 2 because the first round was so yummy and my son ate most of them.  Chicken wings: the BEST you will ever eat. They are spicy yet tangy and are breaded to perfection. We should have ordered more because those were the star of the show!  For entree we ordered the $19.99 Korean spare ribs which were not the best, not the highlight of the evening. The portion was eerily small compared to the price tag of the plate and after eating the wings, the comparison was steep. Also, the service is crazy slow, literally 1 server for 9 tables.  Overall, we ate here once and truth be told, we won't return.

D9NCbisyo7CZUfW13XHtrA.text: It's a very fun place to be! Bring a few friends along for great food, drinks and even karaoke if you want. Or just enjoy the kpop music playing in the background.  I had a little of different things during my previous times, but the most recent, I ate the 12 Fried Chicken piece (garlic Parmesan flavor) for $15.99 and drank Cass beer with it. It's like a complete Korean experience right there since fried chicken and beer is a "common tradition" in South Korea. When I was over there, we literally went to a bunch of fried chicken and beer places over the course of our stay. Heck, we even had friend chicken and beer delivered to our apartment. lol.  So it was awesome to experience fried chicken and beer again. The chicken was extremely flavorful and tender. And you can literally taste the crunchy garlic on top of the chicken. It was so crunchy! And of course, drinking the Korean brand, Cass, beer completes the experience.  It's a little pricey but the food is good. The restaurant is also a little short staffed but I don't know if there is another Korean restaurant in the valley like this one. It's one of a kind at the moment.

KN5EmrTwYsSz0JwPq1ecZA.text: The food here was excellent and service was prompt and polite. I've tried most of their menu and I keep coming back for the Bulgogi fries. Drunken Tiger's food is the most authentic korean food you can find here in Arizona. I recommend coming in and grabbing dinner. Also, if you tell the server named kelvin the phrase, "are you ok anne?" he may provide you with a discount on your meal!

k53yamz6yYfNQC5XwymGsQ.text: Ok so im giving 3 stars because the food was fresh tasting but i will not be coming back here. The food (for lack of better wording) didnt taste very Korean. I should have known pretty much when I asked about the Korean sides along with the Korean barbecue and the waiter explained that they are not a traditional Korean restaurant and did not serve the Korean barbecue with sides. We got beef bulgogi and fried rice. In the past when I've gotten fried rice Korean restaurants (which isn't very often) but when I do get it it taste Korean like it doesn't taste like Chinese fried rice it has a special Korean flavor. The beef bulgogi tasted like when I try to make Chinese stir fry at home. It did not have the Korean flavor it just tasted like meat with soy sauce. It was expensive for what it was. Part of me wanted to send it back but I came with my two year old and he was hungry and had already started eating the food. They had some other interesting things on the menu so perhaps they are more focused on these special items and less on Korean food or flavors. The waiter was in charge of the whole restaurant as well as the bar so the service was not great but he was very nice. Also, when we order the fried rice the waiter said that it had peanuts in it and asked if that was okay and I said yeah. I was not aware that it would be so full of peanuts. There was a disproportionate amount of peanuts compared to Rice. It is unpleasant to have 5 peanuts per bite of rice. I will post a picture.

photos.caption: Photo of Drunken Tiger - Mesa, AZ, United States. The peanut to rice ratio was not okay. Wayyyy too many peanuts.

2zZdK3_AtIPKW1Fm_2vWrg.text: This eccentric little joint is outstanding!  While it has a vibe kind of like a strange sibling of a college bar, the bulgogi is the best I've had in years, and the yogurt soju is similarly spectacular!  I'll be back, and likely frequently!

x5zrMSvRYuP6NfJg9wOrwg.text: Stay away from this place! Came here and asked for a table and the girl in the front said there were no tables. She offered no wait list. She just said there are no tables. I stood there looking at a 12 seat hightop with dirty dishes laying on the table. I said what about that table and she ignored me. This is no way to run a business. Train your employees and make them learn customer service. In the crowded restaurant business there are millions of other options. Go somewhere else if you want to be treated like a human.

VQlTcVBvHk0qhu92IClKIQ.text: So amazing!! Service is great and the people are so friendly and on top of it! The food is incredible!!

PklVgdeeoKQxWoYr2w47ug.text: What can I say about this place? Really good food, good drinks, great atmosphere. I found this little gem a couple months ago and I come here at least once a week and I live in Glendale. The staff is always nice and attentive (if they are busy they will let you know and apologize ahead of time for the wait). My staples are the corn cheese (which is like crack I can't stop eating it) and the Korean Fried Chicken pre-tossed, the bao are very good as well the bread is very sweet and fluffy and the pork belly is cooked perfectly to accompany it. This is a good place to have some drinks and enjoy good food with friends. One of the better Korean places in town.

LTDVJUrGiJi9GP-VoQZ0Yw.text: Gabli was on point!!!!  OB beer always good!  Strawberry Sochu was pretty good but dangerous.... If you know what I mean.  Great experience, awesome service.  Food came out quick and bomb ass kimchi (house made from what I'm told).  We'll be coming back!!! #bombasskbbq

EadCVJvUf6p1KHYKNlZLJQ.text: Awesome place to get drinks and hang with friends ..food and drinks are awesome...get the makgeolli!! Staff is great and atmosphere was very trendy

-_u4_NEMqZ24Fq3BvgO9fg.text: We got the Bulgogi fries, fried chicken, wings, salt and pepper shrimp, ddukbeogi, and the watermelon soju. Food and alcohol were of good quality, but I gave three stars because the service was alright and the food came out at really awkward intervals. Overall was good atmosphere, good food, and good drinks, but the service held it back a bit.

o3LGKql0AwOBfCSwoMemjQ.text: I've been looking for a nice place to visit at night for authentic food, nice drinks, and a great atmosphere. Usually it's impossible to have all three, but Drunken Tiger definitely fits the bill. I'll definitely be visiting again and again!

r_48e7MLv-ZWdTRy_o--3w.text: Woah this place was REALLY GOOD! I enjoyed the ambience. It was super relaxing with my fam. Would totally come with friends too. Food was scrumptious too ^_^ yay! Oh! Also the service was super on top of everything I was really impressed.

Z7WpltjHmgFoiv9HvMe3Lg.text: Drunken Tiger is a good Korean bar food place. Food is better quality from Cafe Agit the previous restaurant. Good environment and good food!

WyBJlxJZFmhHemHDCcLKzQ.text: Service was excellent on a busy Friday night, such a fun place to come together with friends over some delicious Korean bbq beef and soju! Beware the fire chicken, its fire is no joke, but delicious nonetheless! Will definitely be coming again!

l65i9hAZ7GN7M44-_OJMLA.text: This place reminds me of the pojangmacha's that I used to go to back home and is where my friends and I like to go to if we get the itch to play some Korean drinking games without being judged(I hope). I definitely enjoy their menu more now since they've changed ownership. Their fire chicken is bomb if you like spicy and the fact that they have silkworm soup(even though I hate it) is what does it for me. My only request for the owner's is to bring back the crispy duk!

uBp9q4BjIPYIPumhP-W6Lw.text: My favorite place to eat. 2nd time around and they keep up with great food and great customer service. Definitely recommended

4hMlkbRl4ftfOHNxaQpbDQ.text: Ok, maybe 5-stars is a little much for a very modestly decorated... though let's put this in perspective.  It's a little Oasis in an ASU College Town where it can be hit or miss and this place is a HIT.  Lovingly owned and operated by a local family of delightful people who know the ancient secrets of customer delight and magical tasting, fresh Korean cuisine.  Kuy (pronounced Kuai like the Island -- though not sure of the spelling?) is an absolute delight... highly attentive, pleasant and bright.    If you're looking for taste(!) but appreciate attentive service, this is your place.  Full disclosure, I am a pescatarian at the moment and gorged on Korean Beer and Fish Cake Soup.. oh, and I requested a larger spoon.  You can guess why...

DDJ6wTIyzkMc9J3xI9sWAw.text: If you have a meal late at night and everywhere else is closed, this is the place to go! Great for casual outings, dates, or midnight munchies. I've done all three! Food and atmosphere are great and the place can support larger parties of 10 or more.  If you're a first timer, you can't go wrong with their friend chicken selection. If you want some refreshments, there are different Soju options to choose from. You can't go wrong with the good food and a chill environment.

J9oM6cfjaJQb4CWcZdyTsQ.text: I've been to Drunken Tiger twice so far, my bf and I had a great experience. Their service was excellent and the food was amazing! The place itself is quite dark because they do have a bar so that's probably why.  Our first visit, we ordered Tteobokki, Fire Chicken and Soysauce Garlic Popcorn Chicken. - Tteobokki was good! You can't go wrong with tteobokki!  - Fire Chicken, okay this menu is definitely fire! But for some reason, it's not as bad as the Korean fire noodle (Samyang), I can't finish Samyang but I was able to finish the chicken, so it's not bad. - Soysauce Garlic Popcorn Chicken, this menu is AMAZING. Gosh, I wish it was less than $15 for a plate, I can eat this everyday. This popcorn chicken is so good, you can definitely taste the soysauce and garlic, in a good way, so flavorsome!  Our second visit, we ordered Bulgogi and I wanted to order Fire Chicken but I asked the waiter if I could request for the chicken to be fried because I don't like the way it is on my first visit, the server then told me if I want, I could order their popcorn chicken and they will give the "fire sauce", so I said ok cool, let's do that. - Bulgogi, it's a classic. It comes with rice. RESPECT! It was my bf's first time trying Bulgogi and he liked it a lot. He said the beef was so tender and juicy. I tried it as well and it's a good Bulgogi, at least in my opinion. Everyone has different taste and it's okay! - Popcorn Chicken with fire sauce, okay I'm not going to lie, the fire sauce was definitely not the same with the one that comes in Fire Chicken menu. I understand it very well but I can't eat it because all I could taste was the very strong Korean chili paste (Go Chu Jang) and it was hard to enjoy it. I'm glad they gave me the other dip, like a sweet sauce dip and it was so delicious!  I love their food a lot, I'd say it tastes very authentic. It is more on the higher price but their food is worth it. My bf and I will definitely be coming back here again.

9vYA54pISWCyOBB98eKd8g.text: This little Korean place is A+  Ordered - Fried Korean chicken: though I'm a vegetarian I'm kinda eating chicken a lot lately. This chicken was really good with pineapple dip. Not like mind blowingly good, but way better than other places. Popcorn chicken: basically same chicken with onion toppings haha. This came with spicy dip and mayonnaise.  5 beer bucket: tried all Korean beers on the menu. Kloud was my favorite of all 5.   Patio has a water view and cold breeze is just awesome during evenings. Loved time with my friends. Why 4 stars?  It's prolly a 4.5 and ambience was lil thing they need to take care of with service.

qm6xk9KM_kGpLLvQUIM1ug.text: Is this a Korean spot? They advertise soju but it tastes like the cheap 'vodka' blend soju every other knockoff Korean spot has that tastes like way too sweet soda. The galbi.. probably the only 'korean' item we got on the menu was dry and chewy. This place seems to be more geared towards Korean fusion for drunk people. Fries and nachos covered with chorizo marketed as Korean pork because it had some mayo and green onions on it. Takoyaki is clearly japanese, good, but still japanese. Their special was lumpia which is Filipino and was lacking. Everything tasted good I guess, not enough to come back. The overall vibe of this place was very confusing. Service wasnt very attentive,  the waitress couldn't answer my questions and everything came out at once which was overwhelming. Food was okay but I don't think I'll be returning.

fWXQD51o6Y5_jkNPs64mKA.text: I've been now twice and had 2 good experiences, but have yet to come when it's a packed crowd which may change the vibe.   When we pulled up we parked right in front of the doorway to the kitchen... That wasn't a good thing as it a hot mess and somebody was burning something all bad. Keeping my eyes on the doorway I just told myself to focus on the food and not worry about it.   This time around we went with the Salt & Pepper Shrimp, Boneless Korean Fried Chicken, Kimchi Fried Rice and yes, a Good Day drink (which ain't cheap, but damn near sneaks up on you when drinking). 1st time having the Kimchi Fried Rice (with Bacon... yes, everything with BACON is good) and it definitely blew me away. Salt & Pepper shrimp was also on point. Definitely a great late night spot with a decent bar selection along with Hip hop music (Korean and US) bumpin... What's funny is that the music at times seems to go along with videos, but then you realize it's not... but looks good.   Definitely a spot to return too for late night eats with friends when looking to keep it casual!

photos.caption: Photo of Drunken Tiger - Mesa, AZ, United States. Kimchi fries rice with bacon
Photo of Drunken Tiger - Mesa, AZ, United States. Flavored drink that should be shared and creeps up on you

7vixciHUZEY1Q56miw8IhA.text: R A M Y E O N  AKA #RAMEN  . Who doesn't love ramen?! . Drunken Tiger makes the best korean ramen in town. I've been here a couple of times already and it has become one of my favorite korean restaurants. They serve korean street style food!  . My all time favorite is their Korean Fried Chicken served with two different dips. I can never get enough! . This restaurant/bar has ALWAYS been clean and welcoming. The dining area, the bathroom, the entrance, I have never seen anything "filthy." The servers always clean the tables right away as soon as a customer leaves, getting ready for the next customer.  . Also, the servers are always courteous and welcome you with a smile!!  . Food arrives fairly quick, depending if its busy or not!  . They have a variety of soju flavors and cocktails. I have yet to try their watermelon soju!  . I came for the ramen, kfc, and soju. I look forward to my next visit.  #AZteacherfoodie

5KgezE8KDLmDlrZZuZVRpQ.text: My best friend and I decided to go to this place because we were desperate to try some korean fried chicken in Arizona, and there were no regrets! The vibe of this place was really fun (just like us)- we walked in around 5pm on a Sunday, so we didn't experience the chaos that probably happened Saturday night. The kind waiter took us to a booth, and there was only one other group of people at another table (for now).   I can't NOT mention the karaoke part of this experience. You get 'free' 30 minute karaoke sessions by spending at least $10 per person on food and/or alcohol. Since there were 4 of us, we needed to spend $40 (wow quick math) before being able to sing our little hearts out. We ordered our desired boneless fried chicken and some takoyaki while the adults (not my best friend and I) drank some beer. I would have preferred the chicken to be crunchier, but it was still juicy and good! While I am not a fan of mayo, the takoyaki was yummy and burned my tongue a bit (a tasty burn).   By then, more people had arrived so we decided to do some karaoke. Super fun! They have multiple tv screens around the big main room, and the lyrics show up on one of the screens after you choose a song from the giant book. The only sad part was that we couldn't sing any of our favorite kpop tunes because all the titles were in Korean and we can't read :/.   Overall, super entertaining experience (wish you could see the video of us singing Breaking Free in a public space). Now that we're 21, we'll definitely go again and have an even better time ;)

8bpwXbPjs7sGjiclSfDA4w.text: My go to place for Karaoke + drunk munchies lol - the service was always great. I gave four stars cause the food wasnt outstanding - it was good but not great. Ive had better Korean food somewhere. BUT, i like this place a lot for a group hangout, they open late until 2AM on Sat. Parking was easy - just wish they provided more restrooms so I didnt have to wait in line that night. Overall, always a fun time and will def come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Drunken Tiger - Mesa, AZ, United States. Steamed egg

Zd5nH8YCvvnhumTmycMq1A.text: We went to this place for holiday dinner and if anything is to go by, don't be fooled by the looks of this place coz this place is Bomb.   As we entered it looked like a cafe with decent chairs and a sit out. Since we had a huge group we were split coz the place is small for large groups. The service is pretty quick and the menu is vast.  We ordered watermelon soju and green apple soju for drinks. Both were delicious. Personally loved green apple soju.   For the food we ordered a lot of varieties. Corn cheese was heaven it was delicious, my most favorite for the night was salt pepper shrimp, the shrimp was so fresh and crispy. The chicken wings are a win be it the red sauce or the soy garlic sauce. They are all delicious. Popcorn chicken isn't a bad idea either. My second alright list is the fire chicken, it is really really spicy and not for the faint heart. The rice cake, fried rice was not up to the mark but not bad either.   Also not to forget they have Karaoke and it was lit. We had a great time singing.   Overall this place you will definitely understand the meaning of food coma. Price is average and highly recommend this place for everyone. I would definitely go again and can't wait to try other things from the menu.

QQT4sTUfIxnCjA7aW1W8GQ.text: I was very nervous going here my first time as it was my first time trying Korean food but I went along anyway since I heard so many good things about it from my friends. The first thing you notice when you walk in is the vibe of the place is very bar like and seems like a fun place to hangout, karaoke, and most importantly eat!! I asked the waiter for a recommendation and they said that everyone likes the soy garlic chicken so I went for it. It was one of the best chicken dishes I have ever eaten and the chef (Justin I believe) came out and talked to each of us asking if we enjoyed the food. All in all a very great place to enjoy some Korean food and hangout with your friends!!  & don't worry I think the karaoke has auto tune

vS854fTxQh8L-x0saGVv_A.text: Fun place to hang out and get drunk Korean style.  Shared fried chicken with green onions, tteokboki, and bulgogi fries with some beer and soju among 4 people. Great portion and taste. Especially loved the fried chicken with green onions (padak) - light batter, fried to perfect crisp, fresh green onions on top and two kinds of sauce. The sauces were amazing. Tteokboki was chewy with thick sauce and just the right amount of spice.  Servers were friendly and the place was clean. Would recommend for a fun night out with friends or Korean food especially Korean fried chicken!

sOw4LUpQz7MNqchMjvfnQA.text: I found it expensive and just not that great. The watermelon sojo is 23 dollars.  Watermelon and fruity pebbles is nothing id pay that much for. Also got the soy garlic wings which were ok wasnt sure why they came with a mayo sauce.    Music was so loud it made passing gas easier.

There is definitely more things on the menu I want to try so I'll definitely be back!

eaNrgOX1OXz71Je_v7BWtA.text: I love how this place closes super late. Whenever I have Korean cravings late at night, Drunken Tiger saves my life! Everything that I order here hits the spot (except the pupae larvae soup... but come on' even the waiter was honest and weirded out that we ordered it! LOL. That dish is for you if you decide you want to be adventurous!) Aside from that, here's a couple of things that they have that won't disappoint! - Must try # 1 is their boneless korean fried chicken. Their sauce is AMAZING!!! The soy garlic chicken is great too. - The takoyaki won't disappoint either! It's my first time trying it at drunken tiger, and I've had some at other places afterwards, and I must say that theirs is one of the best! - Omnomnomnom the Kimchi fried rice. Feels like I'm in heaven when I took my first bite! It comes in a huge plate so it's definitely shareable! - Their corn cheese is sooo addicting. I know that it's just corn.. and cheese... but I don't know what they do with it that I usually order two plates of that to make sure everyone in my party tries it.  - The bulgogi fries and bulgogi nachos is also a hit among my friends! Definitely a must try if you are craving some fries (waaay better than the animal style fries from In N Out). - Lastly, if you're drinking and chilling with friends, make sure to try the Watermelon Soju. At least do it for the gram!

AYuDkEeIRxdFSI-aWN-ZAw.text: Love this place. Good to hang out during late hours. Fast and friendly service. Good food and drinks. Fun young atmosphere. There's the patio outside for those who want to chill there instead.

v2GzKnDgMlollr7Zf1-2Gw.text: We went to Drunken Tiger for the first time last week. The food was tasty.  Great atmosphere and patio service. The only reason we gave 4 instead of 5 stars was the server was alone and we had to walk up to find her for a few things. She was very friendly!

srRoEMtpSlRA0tBTja8wFg.text: The service here is amazing! The waitresses here are so accommodating. The food, however, was just okay. I ordered the salt and pepper shrimp, spicy squid, and sea food pancake. The seafood pancake dough was a little soggy, like it wasn't fully cooked, but there was a lot of seafood on it. The spicy squid was a bit spicy but the flavor was good; mostly cabbages, carrots, and mushrooms though. The squid was sparse. The salt and pepper shrimp was also a little soggy and didn't really taste like salt and pepper shrimp. It was just lightly fried. Overall, this place was okay in terms of the food, but I'm giving it a four stars because the service was good.

Is6VQTFhbIR8v8TVgErC2Q.text: Cheesy corn is simple but the melted cheese is quite excellent. Takoyaki has good flavor and a good balanced of flavors. Chicken wings with the Korean red is cooked well and has good flavor.

0GyQu7NicWnQslKlBIdpZA.text: Ok 1st off jasmine amd jane gave EXCELLENT service! I wish i took pictures before i ate but  the food was absolutey great. I got the rice cake app and the fire chicken with mozzarella. Sooooo good! I DEFINITELY WILL BE RETURNING! come here you wont be disappointed!

Ten minutes later, the server told us we HAD to pay for the first order even though we didn't want it and even after we changed the order a mere minute after our initial order.
